solution_line_template: Anne and her brother use {anne_usage} gram + {brother_usage} gram = <<{anne_usage}+{brother_usage}={anne_and_brother_total_usage}>>{anne_and_brother_total_usage} grams.

Anne's dad uses {dad_usage} grams and Anne's mom uses {mom_usage} grams so together they use {mom_usage} grams + {dad_usage} grams + {anne_and_brother_total_usage} grams = <<{dad_usage}+{mom_usage}+{anne_and_brother_total_usage}={total_usage_per_brushing}>>{total_usage_per_brushing} grams/wash
Each day, the family uses {total_usage_per_brushing} grams/wash * {brushings_per_day} washes/day = <<{total_usage_per_brushing}*{brushings_per_day}={daily_usage}>>{daily_usage} grams.
Using that amount daily, the toothpaste will last {initial_toothpaste_grams} grams / {daily_usage} grams/day = <<{initial_toothpaste_grams}/{daily_usage}={days_to_run_out}>>{days_to_run_out} days.
